alert.note: Alert for Dickson; Hickman; Humphreys; Perry; Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:18PM CST by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Dickson, northwestern Williamson, northeastern Perry, southern Humphreys and northern Hickman Counties through 500 PM CST... At 418 PM CST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 7 miles southeast of Hurricane Mills, or 15 miles south of Waverly, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Dickson, Centerville, White Bluff, Burns, Hurricane Mills, Charlotte, Lobelville, Bon Aqua, Pinewood, Lyles, Nunnelly and Bucksnort. This includes the following highways... Interstate 40 between mile markers 138 and 182. Interstate 840 between mile markers 1 and 13. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
